item.title: Vim-like keybindings with IntelliJ and friends
item.description: JetBrain’s IntelliJ IDEA is a great IDE for Java development. Here are my keybindings to make it like my Neovim configuration. IntelliJ Configuration Install and enable the IdeaVim plugin. Inside File -> Settings -> Keymap: Copy the ‘Windows’ preset and name it something (optional), mine is VIM. Choose Lookup Item Replace unbind. Down to Down, Tab, and Ctrl+J Up to Up, Shift+Tab, and Ctrl+K Optional: Search Everywhere to Ctrl+Shift+P Tab-complete with Tab (scroll down) and Shift+Tab (scroll up).

About Hi! My name is Brandon. I am currently a second-year Computer Science student at San Diego State University. Currently, I am interested in computer security and systems programming with Go, Python, and Rust. This summer, I will be interning at Intuit. You can find my GPG Key here.
